# Oxide IDE — llms.txt

> A modern IDE that runs in your terminal.

Oxide is a terminal-native IDE built in Rust by Galvanic Labs. It combines familiar IDE features (VSCode keybindings, mouse support, 50,000+ VSCode extensions) with first-class LLM agent integration via the IDE Toolbox Protocol (MCP-compatible).

## Key Facts

- Terminal-native IDE written in Rust
- No modal editing — Ctrl+S, Ctrl+Z, click to place cursor
- VSCode extension compatibility (50,000+ extensions)
- LLM agents are first-class IDE citizens via IDE Toolbox Protocol
- MCP-compatible: works with Claude Code, OpenCode, Aider, and any MCP agent
- Agents can set breakpoints, inspect variables, run tests, stage git hunks
- Built on: ratatui, tree-sitter, tokio, gitoxide, LSP, DAP
- License: Apache 2.0
- Organization: Galvanic Labs

## IDE Toolbox Protocol Tools

- ide.debug.setBreakpoint — Set breakpoints programmatically
- ide.debug.inspectVariable — Inspect runtime variable values
- ide.editor.goToDefinition — Navigate to symbol definitions
- ide.editor.applyFix — Apply code fixes
- ide.diagnostics.list — List errors and warnings
- ide.test.run — Run test suites
- ide.diff.stageHunk — Stage git hunks
- ide.git.status — Get modified files

## Architecture

- TUI Frontend: Editor, File Tree, Terminal, Debug, Git, LLM Agent
- IDE Toolbox Protocol: MCP-compatible tool interface for LLM agents
- Core Services: LSP, DAP, Tree-sitter, gitoxide, tokio
- Extension Host: Rust ↔ Node.js via JSON-RPC, VSCode API shim
